body:
Yeah I agree. Something better would be:
1. a `at::Context::getTypeOpt` which doesn't throw
2. a `at::Type::toBackendOpt` and `at::Type::toScalarTypeOpt` which don't throw.

In terms of return value, would you prefer a reference to undefined, or a null-able pointer?
